title: Pensions: overview of the issues

references.title: The structural pension reform in Chile: Effects, comparisons with other Latin American reforms, and lessons’,
references.raw: Arenas de Mesa, Alberto, and Mesa Lago, Carmelo (2006), ‘The structural pension reform in Chile: Effects, comparisons with other Latin American reforms, and lessons’, Oxford Review of Economic Policy, 22(1).

references.title: Prepared for retirement? The adequacy and distribution of retirement resources in
references.raw: Banks, James, Emmerson, Carol, Oldfield, Zoë, and Tetlow, Gemma (2005), Prepared for retirement?  The adequacy and distribution of retirement resources in England, London: Institute for Fiscal Studies.

references.title: Myths My Grandpa Taught Me,’ Three Banks Review,
references.raw: Barr, Nicholas (1979), ‘Myths My Grandpa Taught Me,’ Three Banks Review, No. 124 (December), pp. 27–55, reprinted in Nicholas Barr (ed.) Economic Theory and the Welfare State, Edward Elgar Library in Critical Writings in Economics, (Edward Elgar, 2001), Vol. II, pp. 83-111.

references.title: The Welfare State as Piggy Bank: Information, Risk, Uncertainty, and the Role of the State, London and New York:
references.raw: Barr, Nicholas (2001), The Welfare State as Piggy Bank: Information, Risk, Uncertainty, and the Role of the State, London and New York: Oxford University Press.

references.title: Turner gets it right on pensions’,
references.raw: Barr, Nicholas (2006), ‘Turner gets it right on pensions’, Prospect, January, pp. 48-50.

references.title: The Economics of Pensions’,
references.raw: Barr, Nicholas and Diamond, Peter (2006), ‘The Economics of Pensions’, Oxford Review of Economic Policy, 22(1). Barr, Nicholas and Diamond, Peter (forthcoming), Reforming Pensions: Principles and an Application to China, New York and Oxford: Oxford University Press.

references.title: A bloody mess’,
references.raw: Cohen, Norma (2005), ‘A bloody mess’, American Prospect, February.

references.title: Human Well-Being and the Natural Environment,
references.raw: Dasgupta, Partha (2001), Human Well-Being and the Natural Environment, New York and Oxford:  Oxford University Press.

references.title: Reforming public pensions in
references.raw: Diamond, Peter A. (2006), ‘Reforming public pensions in the US and the UK’, Economic Journal, 116/509, pp. F94-F118.

references.title: Economic Policy Committee of the European Union
references.raw: Economic Policy Committee of the European Union (2006), The impact of ageing on public expenditure:  projections for the EU25 Member States on pensions, health care, long-term care, education and unemployment transfers (2004-2050), Special Report no. 1/2006, Brussels: European Commission Directorate-General for Economic and Financial Affairs, http://europa.eu.int/comm/economy_finance/publications/european_economy/2006/eespecialr eport0106_en.htm.

references.title: Valuing the Future,
references.raw: Heal, Geoffrey (1998), Valuing the Future, New York: Columbia University Press.

references.title: A New Pension Settlement for The Twenty-First Century? The UK Pensions Commission’s Analysis and Proposals’, Oxford Review of Economic Policy,
references.raw: Hills, John (2006), ‘A New Pension Settlement for The Twenty-First Century? The UK Pensions Commission’s Analysis and Proposals’, Oxford Review of Economic Policy, 22(1).

references.title: The Rationale for Occupational Pensions’,
references.raw: McCarthy, David (2006), ‘The Rationale for Occupational Pensions’, Oxford Review of Economic Policy, 22(1).

references.title: The Imaginary Time Bomb: Why an Ageing Population is not a Social Problem, I.B Tauris.
references.raw: Mullan, Phil (2000), The Imaginary Time Bomb: Why an Ageing Population is not a Social Problem, I.B Tauris.

references.title: Ageing and Employment Policies: ‘Live Longer, Work Longer’,
references.raw: OECD (2006), Ageing and Employment Policies: ‘Live Longer, Work Longer’, Paris: OECD.

references.title: The Swedish experience with pension reform’,
references.raw: Sundén, Annika (2006), ‘The Swedish experience with pension reform’, Oxford Review of Economic Policy, 22(1).

references.title: The US retirement income system’,
references.raw: Thompson, Lawrence H. (2006), ‘The US retirement income system’, Oxford Review of Economic Policy, 22(1).

references.title: Pensions: Challenges and Choices: The First Report of the Pensions Commission,
references.raw: UK Pensions Commission (2004), Pensions: Challenges and Choices:  The First Report of the Pensions Commission, London: TSO, 2004, downloadable from http://www.pensionscommission.org.uk UK Pensions Commission (2005), A New Pension Settlement for the Twenty-First Century: Second Report of the Pensions Commission, London: TSO, 2005, downloadable from http://www.pensionscommission.org.uk US GAO (2005), Social Security Reform: Other countries’ experiences provide lessons for the United States, Report GAO-06-126, Washington DC:  Government Accountability Office.

references.title: Pension Challenges and Pension Reforms
references.raw: Whiteford, Peter, and Whitehouse, Edward (2006), ‘Pension Challenges and Pension Reforms in OECD Countries’, Oxford Review of Economic Policy, 22(1).

references.title: Averting the Old Age Crisis,
references.raw: World Bank (1994), Averting the Old Age Crisis, New York: Oxford University Press.
